hero.description:
We automate processes that are currently manual. Within 30 days you see demonstrable results: fewer hours, fewer errors, more overview.

Most AI projects start too broad. We tackle one process, build a working solution, and show the result within 30 days.

vision.title: Why we do this
content: AI is growing rapidly. Companies that start now gain an advantage. Those who keep waiting will soon be watching competitors who moved faster.

We believe speed makes the difference. Not months of talking about what might be possible, but tangible results within 30 days. We saw it in our own companies: processes that AI solves in weeks, used to cost us months. We now apply that experience for others.

We build tools that work immediately. Automate processes, relieve teams, reduce errors. That delivers peace and performance. More output with less chaos. Work more productively, more focus on what really matters.
But that doesn't happen by itself. It happens by starting. Let's switch.

rob.name: Rob
rob.bio:
Rob switched from accounting to Business Intelligence eight years ago. Founded Easydash - built from zero to nearly 10 employees. Sold it successfully to his partner.

Technically strong, but with clear focus: technology must work in practice. Simple enough that teams actually use it.

With AI he saw the same pattern as with BI. Companies wanted to implement it, but it often got stuck. Too theoretical, too complex, too little connection to daily practice.

Rob takes a different approach. Not building dashboards that two people look at. But solutions the entire team works with. Automate processes that are currently manual. Structure data that is currently scattered.

He combines that technical background with pragmatism. He can build complex, but deliberately chooses solutions that people immediately understand and use.

At Schakel AI, Rob ensures ideas become reality. From concept to working solution that delivers measurable results.

simon.name: Simon
simon.bio:
Simon helped build ROI Financials. Started as an employee, became co-owner after six years, optimized the business and sold it successfully.

When AI broke through, he saw it: optimizing processes took him months, AI did it in weeks. That opened doors. Keep doing what worked, or fully switch to what became possible? Simon chose the latter.

Not to talk about AI, but to concretely move organizations forward with practical implementations.

What drives him? No patience for theoretical plans that disappear in a drawer. He wants to see processes truly become more efficient. From 20 hours of manual work to automated flows. From error-prone input to reliable systems.

Those 11 years of transformation experience taught him one thing: organizations don't need roadmaps, but concrete first steps. Where others start with strategic analyses, Simon starts with the processes that cost the most time right now.

At Schakel AI, he ensures the focus remains on one thing: results.
